movies.title: HOMELESS
movies.description: Filmed in a real shelter with real homeless people, this film tells the story of Gosh, a teenage boy lost in the bleak routine of life in a shelter.

movies.title: Shelter song : art from the homeless
movies.description: Documentarian Joan Laskoff discovers artists and performers who show that dauntless creativity can exist even in the direst circumstances.

movies.title: Lost in America
movies.description: Following director Rotimi Rainwater, a former homeless youth, as he travels the country to shine a light on the epidemic of youth homelessness in America.

movies.title: The Homestretch
movies.description: Following director Rotimi Rainwater, a former homeless youth, as he travels the country to shine a light on the epidemic of youth homelessness in America.

movies.title: After Skid Row
movies.description: After Skid Row documents the journey of Barbie Carter as she navigates the transition to housed life following the brutal reality of a decade on the streets.

movies.title: Game Girls
movies.description: Game Girls follows Teri and her girlfriend Tiahna as they navigate their relationship through the chaotic world of Los Angeles' Skid Row, aka the 'homeless capital of the U.S.'

movies.title: The Public
movies.description: An act of civil disobedience turns into a standoff with police when homeless people in Cincinnati take over the public library to seek shelter from the bitter cold.

movies.title: Samaritan: The Mitch Snyder Story
movies.description: Fact-based story about Mitch Snyder (Martin Sheen), a Washington crusader for the homeless, who took their case to Congress. Working for the Community for Creative Non-violence, Snyder became outraged at the number of homeless people who had been dumped on the Washington streets without shelter from mental institutions and other care facilities.

movies.title: The Blind Side
movies.description: The story of Michael Oher, a homeless and traumatized boy who became an All-American football player and first-round NFL draft pick with the help of a caring woman and her family.

movies.title: The Fisher King
movies.description: A former radio DJ, suicidally despondent because of a terrible mistake he made, finds redemption in helping a deranged homeless man who was an unwitting victim of that mistake.

movies.title: The Advocates
movies.description: THE ADVOCATES is a sweeping look at the history and causes of Los Angeles' current homeless crisis, and an intimate view of the tireless work of advocates who strive to create better lives for their homeless clients.

movies.title: Above and Below
movies.description: A journey through an apocalyptic world following five survivors: Rick & Cindy, Godfather Lalo living in flood channels under Las Vegas, Dave in the Californian desert, and April at a Mars mission simulation in the Utah desert. The film explores challenges and beauty in uncomfortable places.

movies.title: Princess of the Row
movies.description: The inspiring tale of a runaway foster child who will stop at nothing to live with the only family she knows: her homeless, mentally-ill veteran father who lives on the streets of LA's skid row.

movies.title: Without a Home
movies.description: A young woman's desire to understand the homeless epidemic in her native city of Los Angeles takes her on an unexpected 4 year journey into the lives of several homeless individuals as they struggle to find homes, get clean, and survive.

movies.title: Lost Angels: Skid Row Is My Home
movies.description: Narrated by Catherine Keener, this documentary takes an uncompromising yet life-affirming look at the lives of eight remarkable individuals who have found a way to make a life for themselves within the community of Los Angeles's Skid Row, home to one of the largest homeless populations in the United States.

movies.title: One Life at a Time
movies.description: Featuring Dean Cain and Luke Schroder, One Life at a Time highlights both the importance of awareness and the misconceptions of homelessness in West Michigan, in addition to having an historical nod to Mel Trotter.

movies.title: Little Red Wagon
movies.description: Based on the inspirational true story of eight-year-old Zach Bonner on his quest to help homeless children in America. With nothing more than his beat-up red wagon, he walks from his house in Tampa, FL to the White House, overcoming bureaucrats and blisters while capturing the hearts of his fractured family and the entire nation.

movies.title: Dark Days
movies.description: A cinematic portrait of the homeless population who live permanently in the underground tunnels of New York City. Shot in black and white, this documentary brings to light the lives of people living in an abandoned section of the New York City subway system.

movies.title: Ironweed
movies.description: An alcoholic drifter spends Halloween in his hometown of Albany, New York after returning there for the first time in decades. Set during the Great Depression, the film follows Francis Phelan (Jack Nicholson) and Helen Archer (Meryl Streep) as they struggle with homelessness and their past.

movies.title: Leave No Trace
movies.description: Will and his teenage daughter, Tom, have lived off the grid for years in the forests of Portland, Oregon. When their idyllic life is shattered, both are put into social services. After clashing with their new surroundings, Will and Tom set off on a harrowing journey back to their wild homeland.

movies.title: The Lady in the Van
movies.description: After Miss Shepherd, a woman of uncertain origins, 'temporarily' parks her van in Alan Bennett's London driveway, what begins as a begrudged favor becomes a relationship that will change both their lives. Based on a true story.

movies.title: Noble
movies.description: Christina Noble overcomes the harsh difficulties of her childhood in Ireland to discover her destiny on the streets of Saigon. A true story of a woman who helps thousands of homeless and at-risk children in Vietnam.

movies.title: Time Out of Mind
movies.description: Evicted from his squat and suddenly alone on the streets, George is a man without a home. Struggling with his demons and desperately trying to connect with the daughter he abandoned, he navigates the system, hustling for change and somewhere safe and quiet to gather his thoughts.

movies.title: The Justice of Bunny King
movies.description: A triumph over adversity tale about a mother fighting to reunite with her children. Bunny King, a homeless woman and windscreen washer, is trying to secure housing so she can regain custody of her kids, while also protecting her niece from an unsafe situation.

movies.title: Surviving Friendly Fire
movies.description: In the early 90's seventy youth from a Hollywood homeless shelter started a theatre project encouraging them to tell their stories. The youth ran the gamut of racial, cultural and sexual identities. Only ten completed the project and became performers. This film documents the process of creating their play 'Friendly Fire' which was performed at the Los Angeles Festival.

movies.title: A Street Cat Named Bob
movies.description: The true feel-good story of how James Bowen, a busker and recovering drug addict, has his life transformed when he meets a stray ginger cat. Based on the international best selling book.

movies.title: The Christmas Choir
movies.description: A workaholic accountant is inspired to start a choir at a homeless shelter, allowing him to find a purpose to his life and discover the power of music, while providing the choir members with a chance at a new, better life.

movies.title: Streetwise
movies.description: A gritty documentary that looks at the lives of teenagers living on the streets of Seattle. The film follows several homeless youth as they struggle to survive, revealing the harsh realities of street life through their personal stories.

movies.title: 12 Months
movies.description: What would you do if you had one year to change your life...for $1 per month? '12 Months' is a documentary about a Los Angeles man who rents his three-bedroom home for $1 per month to help a family he has never met get on their feet. Told through the eyes of Felicia Dukes and her four children, the project puts a personal face on homelessness and encourages individual action.

movies.title: On the Bowery
movies.description: A documentary that focuses on the lives of three down-and-out alcoholic transients, creating a wrenching portrait of the tragic hopelessness of life on 'The Bowery' in New York City.

movies.title: Chloe and Theo
movies.description: Chloe, a New York City woman, meets Theo, an Inuit from the Arctic, who has come to the city to warn the world about climate change. Together, they embark on a journey to raise awareness and inspire action to save the planet.

movies.title: Animals
movies.description: Animals tells the story of Jude and Bobbie: a young couple that exist somewhere between homelessness and the fantasy of their imaginations. Though they masterfully con and steal in an attempt to stay one step ahead of their addiction, they are ultimately forced to face the reality of their situation when one of them gets hospitalized.

movies.title: Stray Dogs
movies.description: An alcoholic man and his two young children barely survive in Taipei. They cross paths with a lonely grocery clerk who might help them make a better life.

movies.title: Tortu
movies.description: After losing his job and home, Adam moves to France to live with his great uncle. As he navigates his new life, he faces challenges and discovers the complexities of relationships and personal growth.

movies.title: Translated
movies.description: Before his execution in Rome, the apostle Paul is miraculously transported to the modern day United States, where he learns English and attempts to solve some of the problems facing modern Christians.

movies.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
movies.description: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career. Based on the true story of Chris Gardner, who faced homelessness while raising his son.

movies.title: Stock Option
movies.description: When a homeless ex-stock broker rescues a famous model from a robbery attempt, she takes him home as an act of gratitude. Their lives intertwine in unexpected ways as they navigate their personal challenges.

movies.title: Lyfe's Journey
movies.description: A young man struggles to find his way in life while dealing with the challenges of homelessness and the impact of his past decisions. The film explores themes of resilience, redemption, and the importance of community support.

movies.title: Jupiter's Wife
movies.description: A documentary that follows the life of a homeless woman who claims to be the wife of the planet Jupiter. The film explores her experiences and the realities of life on the streets, blending fantasy and reality.

movies.title: The Good Heart
movies.description: A self-destructive bar owner and a young man who is about to die form an unlikely friendship. The film explores themes of love, loss, and the impact of kindness in a harsh world.

movies.title: Boudu Saved from Drowning
movies.description: A bookseller saves a tramp from drowning and shelters him, but the tramp's odd behavior starts to wear everyone down. This classic French film is a satire on social norms and the impact of homelessness.

movies.title: God Knows Where I Am
movies.description: Through diary entries, this documentary follows the life and death of homeless woman Linda Bishop and her struggles with starvation, sanity, and God.

movies.title: MVP
movies.description: On the streets of Hollywood, a recently retired NFL player is saved from scandal by a homeless veteran. With their 'glory days' behind them, the two men bond in search of purpose and identity.

movies.title: The Cold Lands
movies.description: When his self-reliant mother dies unexpectedly, Atticus flees deep into the forests surrounding his Catskills home. Wandering the woods in shock, relying on what meager food and shelter he comes across, Atticus' grasp on reality begins to fray. His nerves worn thin, Atticus latches on when he encounters Carter, a scruffy, pot-smoking drifter, who lives out of his car and sells handmade necklaces on the festival circuit.

movies.title: Waikiki
movies.description: When a hula dancer on the run crashes into a broken spirit of a man, they begin a journey into a hidden world, developing a connection through humanity, nature, and culture.

movies.title: All We Had
movies.description: A mother struggles to make a better life for her daughter while facing the challenges of homelessness and personal hardship. The film explores themes of resilience and the bond between mother and child.
